013    package net.sf.oval.constraint;
014    
015    import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
016    import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017    import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018    import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019    import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020    
021    import net.sf.oval.ConstraintTarget;
022    import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
023    import net.sf.oval.configuration.annotation.Constraint;
024    
025    /**
026     * Check if the date is in the future.
027     * 
028     * <br><br>
029     * <b>Note:</b> This constraint is also satisfied when the value to validate is null, therefore you might also need to specified @NotNull
030     * 
031     * @author Sebastian Thomschke
032     */
033    @Documented
034    @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
035    @Target({ElementType.FIELD, ElementType.PARAMETER, ElementType.METHOD})
036    @Constraint(checkWith = FutureCheck.class)
037    public @interface Future
038    {
039            /**
040             * <p>In case the constraint is declared for an array, collection or map this controls how the constraint is applied to it and it's child objects.
041             * 
042             * <p><b>Default:</b> ConstraintTarget.VALUES
043             * 
044             * <p><b>Note:</b> This setting is ignored for object types other than array, map and collection.
045             */
046            ConstraintTarget[] appliesTo() default ConstraintTarget.VALUES;
047            
048            /**
049             * error code passed to the ConstraintViolation object
050             */
051            String errorCode() default "net.sf.oval.constraint.Future";
052    
053            /**
054             * message to be used for the ContraintsViolatedException
055             * 
056             * @see ConstraintViolation
057             */
058            String message() default "net.sf.oval.constraint.Future.violated";
059    
060            /**
061             * The associated constraint profiles.
062             */
063            String[] profiles() default {};
064    
065            /**
066             * severity passed to the ConstraintViolation object
067             */
068            int severity() default 0;
069    
070            /**
071             * Tolerance in milliseconds the validated value can be in the past. 
072             * This is useful to compensate time differences in distributed environments where the clocks are not 100% in sync.
073             */
074            int tolerance() default 0;
075            
076            /**
077             * Formula returning <code>true</code> if this constraint shall be evaluated and
078             * <code>false</code> if it shall be ignored for the current validation.
079             * <p>
080             * <b>Important:</b> The formula must be prefixed with the name of the scripting language that is used.
081             * E.g. <code>groovy:_this.amount > 10</code>
082             * <p>
083             * Available context variables are:<br>
084             * <b>_this</b> -&gt; the validated bean<br>
085             * <b>_value</b> -&gt; the value to validate (e.g. the field value, parameter value, method return value,
086             *    or the validated bean for object level constraints)
087             */
088            String when() default "";
089    }
